violations_detected.title: Echo method not used
violations_detected.evidence: Customer provides name and city ("Родион Геннадьевич, Екатеринбург"), operator repeats only the name without explicit confirmation question and never echoes or confirms the city, INN, email; phone is only partially confirmed.

violations_detected.title: Long information search
violations_detected.evidence: After "Минута, пожалуйста" the operator is silent while preparing the order; informative answer resumes only at "За ожидание. Пишите...", giving a search duration of about 60.8 seconds (>45s threshold).

violations_detected.title: No thank you for waiting
violations_detected.evidence: After the first search ("Сейчас проверю наличие в этом размере") the operator returns with "Да, есть шины по заказу в этом размере" but does not say "Спасибо за ожидание" or similar thanks for waiting; later phrase "За ожидание" is incomplete and not clearly tied to an explicit thank-you formula.

coaching_priorities.issue: Echo method not consistently used for all contact data (name, city, INN, phone, email).
coaching_priorities.recommendation: After recording any contact data, repeat the exact value (name, city, INN, phone, email) and ask an explicit confirmation question like "Верно?" or "Правильно?", wait for a clear "Да" from the customer.

coaching_priorities.issue: Long silent search during order processing.
coaching_priorities.recommendation: Keep search periods under 45 seconds when possible and regularly check in with the customer; if search will take longer, break it into shorter steps with brief updates so the customer does not wait in silence.

coaching_priorities.issue: No clear "thank you for waiting" after searches.
coaching_priorities.recommendation: After each information search, explicitly thank the customer for waiting using phrases like "Спасибо за ожидание" or "Благодарю за ожидание" before giving the result.

7.1.evidence: Greeting includes company and operator name, asks how to address the customer and from which city; closing is polite and structured.

7.2.evidence: Name, city, INN and email are recorded without full echo method; phone is echoed but only this entity is fully confirmed while others are not.
7.2.note: Echo method must be applied consistently to all contact data (name, city, INN, phone, email).

7.3.evidence: First operator phrase at ~2.47s (<5s) and call disconnect occurs within ~1s after final goodbye.

7.4.evidence: No clear cases where the operator cuts off the customer without an apology; turns change naturally.

6.1.evidence: There is a long search segment, but the customer waits and does not terminate the call; operator closes the call.

9.1.evidence: Search from 7:34.729 to 8:35.565 lasts about 60.8s (>45s), exceeding the allowed search duration.

9.3.evidence: After at least one search the operator resumes conversation without explicitly saying "Спасибо за ожидание" or similar; phrase "За ожидание" is incomplete per text-based rules.

5.1.evidence: Core information about tyres, price, and order details is provided; no obvious missing mandatory information in the transcript.

4.1.evidence: Customer is talkative but operator remains polite, patient and structured; no signs of poor handling.

3.1.evidence: Initial questions about tyre size and choice are resolved and an order is placed for a suitable set; customer agrees.

3.3.evidence: Operator does not disclose third-party confidential data; only discusses the caller's own order details and contacts.

3.6.evidence: Some manufacturing information is given with softeners ("по-моему"), and there is no clear sign of knowingly unverified or incorrect data.

2.1.evidence: No service refusal or unjustified call drop; call ends only after customer confirms there are no further questions.

1.1.evidence: No profanity or rude language from the operator is present in the transcript.

10.2.evidence: Script-based greeting and closing, logical presentation of tyre options and order process.

10.3.evidence: Operator controls the dialogue, asks clarifying questions, makes recommendations and properly closes the conversation.

10.6.evidence: Customer receives key information on tyre size, profile constraints, brand/origin and price; an order and invoice process are set up.

positive_observations: Professional greeting with company and operator name, plus polite closing.
Operator provides detailed explanations about tyre sizes, profiles and brands in accessible language.
Dialogue is well structured; the operator guides a talkative customer without losing control.
The call ends with a concrete result: an order is created and invoice details are agreed.

data_quality.confidence_notes: Evaluation is based on transcript (VTT) and word-level timestamps; audio and external databases were not used.
